comments:
I05201226

I'm running with a set of preferences that's been totally changed from the 
default settings, just to get more code coverage during testing.  Some of my 
preferences may not even make sense, but they're all valid.  They're attached 
in the next comment because they're probably responsible for me seeing this.

- from a fresh install create a cvs connection to dev.eclipse.org and retrieve 
the org.eclipse.swt project
- import my attached preferences (Window -> Preferences, push Import button at 
bottom)
- shut down and restart eclipse
- select the org.eclipse.swt project in the Navigator, right-click -> 
Synchronize with Repository...
- an "error occurred..." dialog pops up, and the following is written to .log

!ENTRY org.eclipse.team.core 4 0 May 21, 2004 11:26:06.595
!MESSAGE Errors occurred during refresh of CVS Workspace
!SUBENTRY 1 org.eclipse.team.core 4 0 May 21, 2004 11:26:06.595
!MESSAGE An error occurred refreshing /org.eclipse.swt: Authentication error: 
com.jcraft.jsch.JSchException: ProxyHTTP: java.net.UnknownHostException: v
!STACK 1
org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.core.connection.CVSAuthenticationException: 
Authentication error: com.jcraft.jsch.JSchException: ProxyHTTP: 
java.net.UnknownHostException: v
	at org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.ssh2.CVSSSH2ServerConnection.open
(CVSSSH2ServerConnection.java:133)
	at org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.core.connection.Connection.open
(Connection.java:127)
	at 
org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.core.connection.CVSRepositoryLocation.createConne
ction(CVSRepositoryLocation.java:568)
	at 
org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.core.connection.CVSRepositoryLocation.openConnect
ion(CVSRepositoryLocation.java:819)
	at org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.core.client.Session.open
(Session.java:142)
	at 
org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.core.resources.RemoteFolderTreeBuilder.fetchDelta
(RemoteFolderTreeBuilder.java:219)
	at 
org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.core.resources.RemoteFolderTreeBuilder.buildTree
(RemoteFolderTreeBuilder.java:187)
	at 
org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.core.resources.RemoteFolderTreeBuilder.buildRemot
eTree(RemoteFolderTreeBuilder.java:159)
	at 
org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.core.resources.CVSWorkspaceRoot.getRemoteTree
(CVSWorkspaceRoot.java:230)
	at 
org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.core.syncinfo.CVSResourceVariantTree.fetchVariant
(CVSResourceVariantTree.java:100)
	at org.eclipse.team.core.variants.AbstractResourceVariantTree.refresh
(AbstractResourceVariantTree.java:95)
	at 
org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.core.syncinfo.CVSResourceVariantTree.refresh
(CVSResourceVariantTree.java:303)
	at org.eclipse.team.core.variants.AbstractResourceVariantTree.refresh
(AbstractResourceVariantTree.java:64)
	at org.eclipse.team.core.variants.ResourceVariantTreeSubscriber.refresh
(ResourceVariantTreeSubscriber.java:157)
	at org.eclipse.team.core.variants.ResourceVariantTreeSubscriber.refresh
(ResourceVariantTreeSubscriber.java:123)
	at org.eclipse.team.internal.ui.synchronize.RefreshSubscriberJob.run
(RefreshSubscriberJob.java:271)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:66)
!SUBENTRY 2 org.eclipse.team.cvs.core 4 2 May 21, 2004 11:26:06.595
!MESSAGE Authentication error: com.jcraft.jsch.JSchException: ProxyHTTP: 
java.net.UnknownHostException: v

Are you suggesting that the connection should have worked or that the error 
should not have been logged?

Writing a stack to .log and showing an "error has occurred" dialog gives the 
impression of an eclipse bug.  It seems like the exception should be detected 
and the user notified by a nicer means, with no stack dumped to .log.

It appears that Grant configured SSH2 to use a proxy server but the server 
name is bogus. We should ensure that the error that is presented to the user 
is understandable.

The error reporting has been improved but the .log message is what we get for
free from runtime. When a job returns an error status, it is automatically
logged from core. And this includes the stack trace which makes it look worse
than it really is.
